Posts.Content: May 12, 2010 08:55PM lovethesea wrote: Dear palaminoridesagain: I'm Stage IV and a 23 yr. survivor.  Even though I'm still around (grateful yet shocked) the "suckie" feeling of wondering what comes next pops it's ugly head up every other day.  I've had so many needed "crys" and your feelings are common to our group.  As many, I try to keep a positive attitude and live each day as if it were my last, but the underlying knowledge is always with us. I'm wishing you a sun filled weekend, peace and some joy...remember, you're still with us. Much love and  many hugs, Lindy
Posts.Title: Does this ever happen to you? palaminoridesagain jeanne46

Posts.Content: May 4, 2010 09:45PM lovethesea wrote: Dear lukejessesmom:  I so understand how you feel.  Although I have a wonderful husband and family, I often feel so alone with my Stage IV IBC and have experienced similar feelings.  I so wish that we could all be physically together as a group for understanding and continued support.  Like you, I love life and (after 23 yrs.) am so thankfull for each day.  So far, Zometa and Aromasin have worked for me.  I don't look sick (photo I have on this "site" was taken 4 mos. ago) and people assume I'll be around forever.  Just so you know, I'm sending understanding, love and continued support for you and your boys. It's been 2 yrs. since my last PET and I'm scheduled for one on May 11th....a scary time and I'm sure you understand.  Much love and many hugs, Lindy
Posts.Title: It's hard to stay positive lukejessesmom Padiddle

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 02:46AM lovethesea wrote: Dear ej: I was diagnosed w/breast cancer as a pre-menopausal woman in 1987.  I had 5 of 14 positive nodes, poorly differenciated and was ER+.  My oncologist chose 7 mos. of CMF Chemo and tamoxifen.  I stayed on tamoxifen for 10 yrs. even though it was only recommened for post-meno woman.  At about 17 yrs. survival and thinking I was cancer free, I was diagnosed with State 4 mets to 5 areas of the bone.  I had one node that lived, wrapped itself around my right arm axillary nerve and a major vessal with mets to 5 areas of the bone.  I immediately (in 2006) began Aromasin and Zometa (once monthly.)  My arm symptom disappeared after 3 months and has not returned.  I've had 2 PET Scans since with the second one not even showing the node.  I'm scheduled to have a 3rd PET two weeks from now and will let you know how it goes.  I welcome each day pain free and am now in my 60's having lived with cancer in my body for 23 yrs.  You'll be in my thoughts and prayers.  Lindy Griffin  (lindy_mcconnell@comcast.net)
Posts.Title: stage IV breast to bone mets ejnova reesie
